TopicTitle: Is this a sufficient number of mods or do I need more power(mods).

Articles.Content: After much deliberation I've decided that I have no idea!

All depends... on your playstyle, how long you are willing to wait while the game loads, switches scenes, and how long before you have to restart the game; and your tolerance for problem solving with very little data; mostly your playstyle.

But if you have more than say 300 mods, and it takes longer than say ten minutes to load a game, with a SSD, RAMDisk, and MM cache -- then you might need to go to your nearest 'Modcoholics Anonymous' meeting - wiki-wiki.

You DO NOT want to see my GameData folder, and especially my KSPDEV folder.... and wait, *watch beeping* it's time for my Daily MA meeting... "Hi, I'm zer0Kerbal and I'm a Modcoholic. It has been -1 minutes since my last mod install...."

Edited March 20, 2022 by zer0Kerbal

28 minutes ago, zer0Kerbal said:

Oh just wait till I install bdb when it’s Apollo overhaul drops, my ten min load time will go up to like an hour

actually we need a modaholic anonymous thread it’s become a serious epidemic in this community

My favorite part about my mod list is that AVC insists I have airline cuisine installed but here’s the catch… I don’t. It’s actually incredibly scary…

Spoiler

Oh yes my favorite mod
I once set out to create a strictly "minimal" mod list using only the essentials... it has 80 mods.
